text.text_translated: The Capitol organizes the Hunger Games each year. It does this to show the districts they are punished for rebelling. Each year, one boy and one girl aged 12 to 18 are chosen from each district in a lottery. These teenagers are called tributes. They are sent to a large area where the Games take place. There, they must fight until only one person lives. This shows the Capitol has total control over the nation. The Games are shown on TV, and everyone must watch them.
